Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hawkergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Daisy Hotel in May last year. It looked lovely on Trip Advisor and the few reviews were good. A hotel that was not a budget option, medium priced, quaint, in the old quarter with sea views and attractive rooms. It was in fact a tiny pension with no public rooms. The three bedrooms were tiny, damp, once attractive but now tired decor peeling from the walls, a useless television that couldn't be tuned to anything and sanitary ware that leaked over everthing in the tiny bathroom. The breakfast was little short of a joke - prepared in the entrance lobby (and lobby flatters what was barely the size of a small storm porch) for you to take back to your musty room if you were lucky enough to get the only one with a bit of a sea view or up to the roof terrace which was in deplorable repair with soggy broken furniture to perch on. On the plus side Aziz was charming, the location was perfect for site seeing and the area around the hotel was old and very interesting. We loved our stay but thought The Daisy was very over priced for a pension at the very budget end of budget accomodation. PS never waste money on taxi's in Istanbul, the public transport is excellent - reliable, easy to navigate, fun and cheap as chips!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: newbie1982
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to Istanbul and Daisy Hotel about 6 months before travelling there in October 2011. We'd read other reviews on this site and were concerned about people arriving and being told that there was no booking for them so emailed a few weeks in advance and were ensured that everything was ok with our booking. On arrival at the hotel we were disappointed with the size of our room, the 'city view' which was just out onto the street and also the fact that that the shower didn't have any enclosure and that the room was very cold with very limited bedding! A couple of days into our stay we were informed that we were going to be moving hotel, although we weren't keen on the Daisy Hotel we were upset to have to spend time packing, moving and unpacking our belongings to move to a different hotel - especially as we'd been assured prior to travelling that our booking was confirmed. The move turned out to be a positive one to a much nicer hotel however it caused disruption to our holiday due to having to pack and return to the hotel half way through the day to move and unpack. Some people on here have criticised the breakfast, I found this to be adequate and very similar to what was on offer in other hotels and cafes although a bit more basic possibly.

Reviews.Title: “Love the vew over the sea”
Reviews.Author: Jojo1980k
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel but clean and has good location in sultan Ahmed The break fast is very basic and it's in another hotel near bay I liked the vew and the balcony in the tripol room for my family

Reviews.Title: “RUNAWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ioustinim
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with sea view 2 months before my planned trip to Istanbul and frankly this was the main reason I chose to stay there(balcony and sea view). When we arrived there the owner Aziz told us that he didnâ€™t have a room like the one I booked even though I had confirm it 5 days prior to our arrival and he gave us one facing the road ,no sea view no balcony only a window. The room was too small, it lacked a shower cabinet (not even a simple curtain) so every time we used it the floor flooded with water. The room smelled very badly, even though we left all the windows open during the morning, only one towel per person. No soap, no toilet paper. The first time I saw the breakfast table I couldnâ€™t stop laughing so I had to take a picture of it. You had to carry it on the terrace from the stairs without anything to put your dishes on. They washed the dishes in a small WC used as a kitchen!!I I complained to Aziz telling him that he should reduce the amount I had to pay. He told me that he couldnâ€™t do that but due to the inconvenience we would provide us with free airport transfer for our departure.Of course the day we were leaving the shuttle bus never came, Aziz was not there and he didâ€™t answer his phone so after 45 min of waiting we took a taxi because otherwise we would have missed our flight. He reported us at the booking site as non-shown so as not to be able to write a review and probably he does that all the time because when I contacted the site they didnâ€™t seem to be surprised. This was the worst experience I had from a hotel

Reviews.Title: “the best stay we had”
Reviews.Author: dodo182
Reviews.Content: its a very good hotel located near to all the tourists attractions and historical sites in Sultanahmet area. Furthermore the services provided by this hotel is amazing as all the hotel employees are nice and they treated us kindly especially Mr. Aziz, the humble manager of this hotel. Overall, my family and i enjoyed our stay in Daisy Hotel so much and we will definitely come back to stay there the next time we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hawfull B&B”
Reviews.Author: dado145
Reviews.Content: First of all, Daisy is not an Hotel but an awfull B&B. When I decided to book it I did it because I read fantastic reviews and saw delightful pictures. Probably both manipulated. When I arrived in Istanbul, the owners told me that owing to an overbooking they would have to accommodate me and my family for a night in a different location. In this way I gave them the time to cash the whole amount of the week from the credit card that I used with the Hotel Booking. When I saw the real poor condition of the structure it was too late. The remaining days were a chain of discomforts: a crowded train line extremely close to the building, a four lane avenue at fifty meters, an indecent bathroom with a flooded floor (anytime you opened the faucet), uncovered electric wires hanging the walls, humidity, noisy and every other kind of disturbance. The last day the unpleasant situation reached its height when someone stole my laptop and my mobile phone.

Reviews.Title: “we had a fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: anastasia a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in july 2011, and we had a fantastic time. Istanbul is a great city, and the hotel is very centrally located, very close to public transport. The hotel is very new, well furnished and the staff is great. Fantastical view from balcony

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: larisa i
Reviews.Content: Perfect location,best prices,kind people,nice rooms-that all you find in Daisy Hotel.i hope to stay in it in future again.

Reviews.Title: “Like home, with all the comforts, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: NijmegenFeso
Reviews.Content: On the advice of friends I stayed in Daisy hotel. When I arrived I was already charmed by the location. It is located in a friendly neigborhood within five minutes walk of the main sights of old Istanbul: Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi palace, and so on. The owner immediately showed me the terrace which is even more beautiful. There is a wonderful view on the Marmara Sea and the waterside where you can see people stroll around and enjoy Istanbul's versatility. The sea is even more close. Sometimes I just walked up to the sea to enjoy the fresh air after an exciting day in the city. The room where I stayed was clean, with every comfort and the hotel felt from the first minute like home because the staff was very friendly and helpful when needed. I was alone, but I think it is also a good place for families or couples because it is friendly and quiet but nonetheless within a couple of minutes walk from the must-sees of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy informal presonalised hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: bharath h
Reviews.Content: We started our family holiday with istanbul, and this was our first stay,after we stepped out of the cab initially i was surprised to see that the place was smaller than what i was expecting from the pictures, but all of that was forgotten as we entered the rooms and person in charge aziz showed up with coffee tea and smiles. There were five of us travelling and the sea facing room with the balcony was a treat, so was the room with the street view. It is an excellent location to walk around and explore Sultanahmet. We were worried if the train lines passing close by would be of annoyance but it turned out to be not an issue at all. Since there were not many guests nor many people in the hotel at that time we felt like it was a private residence as we also had a copy of the main door keys to step in and out whenever we felt like. The rooms were clean and spacious the decor was pleasant and not generic, the bathrooms are on the smaller side, but they were clean and sufficient. Even though there wasnt staff around the clock in the hotel we didnt feel any problems with the service. We enjoyed conversations with aziz and others who helped him and picked up tips and suggestions for the next leg of our trip. We were feeling uneasy when we learnt that some of the domestic flights which we were take for the next few destinations had strict baggage allowance. and we requested if aziz could take care of one of our bags very sheepishly, but he was really helpful, and stored the bad away. And after couple of weeks i called him and met him to take the bag and again he was very helpful. We werent sure of how the breakfast works in turkey so initially we were surprised with the basic servings and quantity served for breakfast, but it was rich and sufficient for all of us. I would definitely come back here because it felt like we made a new friend, the service was personalized, the whole place had a unique character unlike a generic chain hotel. Istanbul is generally expensive so in retrospect it was good value for money and also because of the deal we got through booking.com it was quite a steal.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: thoming
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the night as announced before. Nobody was there. After a few phone calls the owner came and apologized that there is a problem. We had to stay for one night in a partner hotel which was horrible. The next few days we stood in the Daisy. If you consider that this is a pretty new hotel the rooms are not well maintained. the paper comes from the wall, the bathroom door does not close,.... I think it's system to overbook the rooms and let the guests stay in crappy partner hotels.

Reviews.Title: “excellent will return”
Reviews.Author: adith80
Reviews.Content: Aziz will help you get aclimitised istanbul; felt like we had a home in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid avoid !!!”
Reviews.Author: Clarrie69
Reviews.Content: No room for us. taken to alternative hotel with no room for 4 of us. Looks as if this happens all of the time. Do not book this hotel

Reviews.Title: “a holiday like a dream”
Reviews.Author: rickrack_11
Reviews.Content: yes we saw pictures of daisy hotel in booking.com but weren't think the view is better than photos. There is a balcony it's make you relax after city tour. The owner Aziz is really helpfull. One of the place like museum Daisy hotel you must see. The breakfast is not rich but ok because we didnt care breakfast too much.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: michellePrague
Reviews.Content: I have booked a room with a see wiev at Daisy hotel 5 months before my planned trip to Istanbul, I contacted directly the hotel (guy Aziz), for confirmation of my rezervation he asked for my credit card details. Aziz charged straight away the whole amount (5 nights). I was quite supprised and kindly asked him to send me money back. He emailed he would send me money back however for 3 weeks nothing have been happening, after several emails from my side he finally send me money via Wester Union (in fact I received 65 euros less). Aziz promised to provide us both airport transfers free plus one night free to compensate the money. Before our arrival I contacted Aziz to remind him we are arriving, he replied he will picked us up at the airport on time. When we arrived of course there was no one waiting for us at the airport, after 30 min of waiting we took a taxi to the hotel (it was 3:30 in the morning). Daisy hotel was locked, so I called Aziz (he provide me his cell phone), I woke him up, he showed up in 20 minutes with appologies that there is no free room for us. As mention in other rewiews, he took as with a taxi to other hotel in Beazit, little further from Sultanaahmed. The hotel was brand new, with no name. We choose a room and from that moment everything was great. It was only us in the hotel, they treated us very well, nice breakfast. I told to Aziz that I would pay him at the end of our stay only if I see taxi to the airport minus 20 euros from the taxi from the airport minus 65 euros that he owns and it finally happened. We really enjoyed our stay. I suppose AzizÂ´ English is quite limited and he doestn care if he has a free room or not some guest booked, he just send guests to one of the partner hotel that is quite unfair.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Safe, Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: Krun00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during an April 2011 visit. We stayed in 2 different rooms while we were here. We stayed in a large family style room with a Bospherus view and a smaller couples room (street view). Both rooms were very clean and comfortable. This is a small property and there isn't an office. Make sure to arrange your arrival details in advance. We loved the location as we walked everywhere. Also we felt very safe here. We would absolutely stay here again. Aziz? (oops might forgot his name) was great. BTW, there is a train that runs in front of the property. It didn't run too early, we actually found it added to the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Despite our reservation, they had no rooms and sent us to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: afreund83
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation here along with two male friends for two nights in April 2011 in a triple room for 75 euro a night. The hotel is located in Sultanhamet, a 5-10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. We made our reservation online several weeks before and confirmed it directly with the hotel. However, when we arrived the owner informed us that he had no rooms (not sure why - his Enligsh was limited and we couldn't communicate well) and that we would stay at a partner hotel of similar quality. The partner hotel, which was about 10 minutes away walking, was not on the water, though it was closer to the Blue Mosque. The partner hotel room was decently nice, but has no bearing on this review. We appreciate that they relocated us efficiently and quickly, but were annoyed that we didn't get the room we had reserved and that there was no mention of this complication via email before we arrived. Another group of people we met that weekend had the exact same problem - they were turned away to a partner hotel. This may have been an isolated two-day incident, I can't say. We had to walk to Daisy Hotel for breakfast the next morning. Not much of a problem, but the buffet breakfast was quite poor compared to others on our trip. Only a small selection of vegetables/fruit and bread with jam. We ate on the terrace on the top floor, which was decently nice with a view of the river. Pros: -good location and terrace Cons: -did not have rooms, sent us to a partner hotel in what seemed like a worse area of town -poor breakfast -staff has limited English

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,cosy hotel with friendly ,helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: dewdrop61
Reviews.Content: Small quite cozy hotel with terrace on Bosphorus view , friendly staff ,morning coffe and very good location(old city) for Istambul visitors

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda186605
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with friends while travelling, Lovely little hotel,rooms are really clean and the view is beautiful. The staff are very friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “It is really a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaGeller
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect all main sights within a short walking distance! The bath towels were changed everyday. Excellent value for money and a really nice hotel in general...

HotelInfo.Name: Daisy Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Kucuk Ayasofya Caddesi, Cayiroglu Sok No: 32 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
